definitions.definition: a sloping channel or slide for conveying things to a lower level.
examples: channel, slide, shaft, funnel, conduit icy water came rushing down the chute

definitions.definition: a water slide into a swimming pool.
examples: channel, slide, shaft, funnel, conduit icy water came rushing down the chute

definitions.definition: short for chute-the-chute.
kill or wound (a person or animal) with a bullet or arrow.
examples: he was shot in the leg during an armed robbery
synonyms: plug "they shot him in the street"

definitions.definition: fire a bullet from a gun or discharge an arrow from a bow.
examples: he shot at me twice
synonyms: emit "faster than a gun can shoot bullets"

definitions.definition: cause (a gun) to fire.
damage or remove (something) with a bullet or missile.
examples: Guy, shoot their hats off

definitions.definition: hunt game with a gun.
examples: we go to Scotland to shoot every autumn

definitions.definition: shoot game over (an estate or other area of countryside).
shoot game in or on (an estate, cover, etc.).
move suddenly and rapidly in a particular direction.
examples: the car shot forward

definitions.definition: cause to move suddenly and rapidly in a particular direction.
examples: he would have fallen if Marc hadn't shot out a hand to stop him

definitions.definition: direct (a glance, question, or remark) at someone.
examples: Luke shot her a quick glance

definitions.definition: used to invite a comment or question.
examples: “May I just ask you one more question?” “Shoot.”

definitions.definition: (of a pain) move with a sharp stabbing sensation.
examples: Claudia felt a shaft of pain shoot through her chest

definitions.definition: (of a boat) sweep swiftly down or under (rapids, a waterfall, or a bridge).
(of a motor vehicle) pass (a traffic light at red).
extend sharply in a particular direction.
examples: a road that seemed to just shoot upward at a terrifying angle

definitions.definition: move (a door bolt) to fasten or unfasten a door.
(in soccer, hockey, basketball, etc.) kick, hit, or throw the ball or puck in an attempt to score a goal.
examples: Williams twice shot wide

definitions.definition: make (a specified score) for a round of golf.
examples: in the second round he shot a 65

definitions.definition: play a game of (pool or dice).
film or photograph (a scene, film, etc.).
examples: she has just been commissioned to shoot a video
synonyms: video "the film was shot in Toronto"

definitions.definition: (of a plant or seed) send out buds or shoots; germinate.
(of a bud or shoot) appear; sprout.
examples: sprout, bud, burgeon, germinate the plant failed to shoot

definitions.definition: inject oneself or another person with (a narcotic drug).
examples: he shot dope into his arm

definitions.definition: plane (the edge of a board) accurately.
a young branch or sucker springing from the main stock of a tree or other plant.
examples: he nipped off the new shoots that grew where the leaves joined the stems

definitions.definition: an occasion when a group of people hunt and shoot game for sport.
examples: a grouse shoot

definitions.definition: land used for shooting game.
a shooting match or contest.
examples: activities include a weekly rifle shoot

definitions.definition: an occasion when a professional photographer takes photographs or when a film or video is being made.
examples: a photo shoot

definitions.definition: variant spelling of chute1.
a rapid in a stream.
examples: follow the portages that skirt all nine shoots of whitewater
